_header: A knight there was in land while great man withall and wise
_description: Saved by learning Two Words, a miracle of the Virgin, in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
A Knight þer was in lond while gret man with all & wisAtte
                    last he him bithoughte þat þe world was of litel
                    pris…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…An y seye hou god it was Oure lady to greteȜet we wole
                    more telle Of hire þat is so suete
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
A knyȝt þer was a londe whyse gret man with alle &
                    wysatte laste he be þoȝte þat þe worlde was of lite
                    prys…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…And y seȝe how guod it was oure Leuedy to greteȜut
                    we willeþ telle more of here for hy is guod & swete

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
A knyght þer was whilome in lande a grete lorde & wyseAnd
                    ate laste he hym be thoght þis worlde was of litil prisHe put hym to
                    religioune & al þis worlde forsokeffor to serue god & our lady
                    to þaim he hym betoke…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…&sagh þat it was nedeful þinge our lady for to
                    greteBlissed mote scho euer be boþe maiden & modre
                    swete

CamCCC145.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was a londe wile gret man wiþ alle
                    iwisAtte laste he him biþoȝte þat þe worle was of lite
                    pris…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…And iseie hou god it was oure leuedi forto greteȜute we
                    wolleþ telle more of hure he is so god & swete
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 234.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was in londe while gret man wiþ alle
                    ywisAtte laste he him by þouȝte þat þe world was of
                    lutel pris…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þere alle yseye how goed hit is oure lady to
                    greteȜut telle we wolleþ more of hure ffor ȝeo is so goed
                    & swete

CamTCC605.First Lines: A knyȝt þer was wyle grete man mydalle & wyseAtte laste he hym byþoȝt þat þe worle was of lyte prise…
CamTCC605.Last Lines: …þer by me may yse hou goud hit ys to greteof oure leuedy marie þat is so mylde & swete
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was a londe wile gret man wiþ alle y
                    wisAtte laste he him by þoȝte þat þe worle was of lite
                    pris…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…And yseie hou gode it was oure lady forto greteȝut we
                    wulleþ telle more of hure ȝo is so gode & swete

BLCottCleoDIX.First Lines:
[A] kniȝt þer was a lond while gret man wiþ al
                    iwisAte laste he him biþouȝt þat þe world was of lute
                    pris…
BLCottCleoDIX.Last Lines:
…And iseiȝe hou gode hit was oure leuedi forto
                    greteȜut we wolleþ telle more of hire for ȝeo is so gode
                    & swete
BLCottCleoDIX.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Space left for enlarged
                    ‘A’, which was left blank.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: A kniȝt þer was alonde while gret man with alle & wisate laste he him biþoȝte þat þe worle was of lute pris…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& seie hou god hit was our ladi forto greteȝut we wollet telle more of hire heo is so gud & suete
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum Cvi” added to right margin by later hand (f. 304).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLHar2277.First Lines: A kniȝt was while a riche man þat honurede moche mid alleOure leuedi & alle hire festes þat in þe ȝer doþ falle…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Of oure leuedi faire Miracles we seoþ al day & greteÞeȝ we habbe of summe itold ȝut nole we noȝt lete
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2277.

Tryon,  Ruth Wilson. 
             “Miracles of Our Lady in Middle English Verse.” 
             PMLA
         38 (1923): 308-81: 319-20.
